website_summaries.verdict: The Trendnet TEW-692GR 450 Mbps Concurrent Dual Band Wireless N Router provides cutting-edge wireless technology but falls a little short on 2.4GHz throughput performance, comparatively.
pros: The Trendnet TEW-692GR 450 Mbps Concurrent Dual Band Wireless N Router features 450Mbps on both the 2.4GHz and 5GHz bands
It offers fast throughput speeds on the 5GHz band, long range, Gigabit Ethernet, and an easy-to-use Web interface
cons: The TEW-692GR's throughput on the 2.4GHz band could use some improvement
The router doesn't have support for IPv6, and lacks storage and print-serving capabilities

customer_reviews.title: A little disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The 5ghz band is a little under powered, I only get about 40% signal where my old dead AP would let me get 60-70%...However, even with a low signal, 5ghz N is still fairly fast. The 2.4ghz is another story. Weak would be ok if that's all it was. The 2.4 band seems to drop data for 1-4 seconds every 30seconds-1 minute. It's not a weak signal causing it either. I have well over 70% signal on my laptop and about 50% on my phone and they both show the data drops at the same time. It's not the signal that's dropping, wifi analyzer shows a consistent signal level. It just refuses to send data for a little bit.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Johns

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Its a gigabyte router. It performs well. I think it has a poor user interface. I also do not like the inability to repeater a wifi signal to stretch our current wifi signal. Most routers today have that option. It was a good deal for the price for black friday 2013. If it wasn't discounted so much, I would not have purchased this router.
customer_reviews.author: Brady Communications

customer_reviews.title: Wireless for the rest of us.
customer_reviews.text: WOW this unit is a really great solution. I have a Roku up stairs, a computer down stairs, a Microsoft Surface and a NookColor, plus a laptop all connected to this wireless device. Netflix streaming on two computers at the same time doesn't even hesitate. Setup was simple with the wizard. Installation took less than 10 monutes. Great Product
customer_reviews.author: Pakeha

customer_reviews.title: Did not work
customer_reviews.text: Only the 5.0 band would work, older devices would not connect to it. Amazon was great in their return policy however though offering a refund if I mailed back the unit. I forgot to do this so I still have the unit but very happy with Amazons support. I think this was just a defective unit/bad luck as overall I have heard good things about TRENDnets products.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Graziano

customer_reviews.title: Great router
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the performance, especially the dual-band ... my TV and TiVo connected right up at 5 GHz, while everything else runs at 2.4 GHz. It only supports one LAN (although multiple SSIDs). I set up one "open" SSID, and then one with WPA2 for my own devices. As close to plug-and-play as it gets, after I entered the necessary WAN port configuration. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Michael V. Raffety

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap!
customer_reviews.text: I set this up as an access point (disabled DHCP)- only wanted to use it for the wireless. About 10 days later I'm having to power cycle it every few hours to keep it online. It locks up for no reason and the wifi dies and you can't log into it.
customer_reviews.author: JTP

customer_reviews.title: Ready to FLY
customer_reviews.text: What a Router this Baby SCREAMS SPEED!!!!! The wireless speed is just amazing when paired with TEW-684UB and TEW980MB. The speed is the same as wired connections. When watching a video streaming there is no lag, instant playing of the video. Netflicks loads faster and streams without a hipcup. I never thought a wireless connection could be this good. I have become a TRENDnet 5 star fan!!!!! If you like to stream this is the router you want!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: RiverFR

customer_reviews.title: Loses internet connections constantly
customer_reviews.text: I chose this based on price and specs. Range is much worse than my old Linksys e2000. It drops connections on my iphone 5 and laptop. I downloaded the latest firmware and disable Upnp as some had recommended. Contacted tech support via email and no response after 4 days. Last Trendnet purchase for me...
customer_reviews.author: Scott McKinney

customer_reviews.title: Easy set-up, fast speeds
customer_reviews.text: Setting up the router was a breeze, and the dual band wifi is super fast. My small apartment has 3 wifi networks now due to a modem that my ISP provided, but the N900's networks are way faster. The user interface is great for experienced networkers and novices alike and provides an easy quick set-up as well as more detailed options.
customer_reviews.author: badger

customer_reviews.title: TRENDnet N450 very good, basic feature router
customer_reviews.text: I have tested 5 routers recently in search of the best for my home. The TRENDnet is a very solid contender with good range and high stability. The only negative is that the router is very basic in features: no USB, no Cloud, etc. Its a pure Dual Band WiFi router that does what it does very well.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Matt

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your time or money.
customer_reviews.text: Did not work. Only 1 band would connect and I never could get the second band to show up. Luckily I got a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Dodson

customer_reviews.title: The TEW - 692GR Discontinued Wireless Dual Band Router is great if you can get one that works. 2 out of 3 failed out of the BOX
customer_reviews.text: Bought three so far 2 were bricks out of the BOX. Hassle getting permission to send back and slow turn around getting the next one that did not power up! Not the power supply either. Bricks no lights and lengthy time to get resolution. They would do better monitoring their RMA requests more often than once per week or so. After the next one I will go to another model. By the way if you can get one of these that actually work out of the box they are really nice.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Payne

customer_reviews.title: Does not work!
customer_reviews.text: Setup was easy but product does not function as advertised! 2.4 GHZ Wireless network appeared to be on and functioning but could not see it on any device as if it was not transmitting. I checked reviews as I should have did in the first place before buying and was shocked to see that so many people had dealt with the same issue. Waste of time and money! Also I found out this product is Manufacturer Discontinued and replaced by another version. Do not buy this item it is known as defective!
customer_reviews.author: Keith A Moeller

customer_reviews.title: Love trendnet
customer_reviews.text: The 692 is a great router.....I was so impressed that when the AC router came out I sold the692 and got the AC router...love TRENDNET😎
customer_reviews.author: Bill Thomson

customer_reviews.title: No Range, and poor mounting options.
customer_reviews.text: Well, seems very reliable and stable , no dropouts. But the WiFi range is no better then the N Speed model from trendnet it just replaced. Very disappointed in the range. The stand is floppy and weak, and no wall or table mounted screw locations are present for a sturdy mount. But seems no faster or any better speed wise then the 300 mbps N Speed model.
customer_reviews.author: Dtro

customer_reviews.title: Love the 5ghz connection
customer_reviews.text: It works way better than my Netgear router and I can move from room to room with my laptop with no connection problems with the 5ghz connection. My brother has some problems because his laptop can only connect to the 2.4ghz connection, but it works good most days for him.
customer_reviews.author: Akula Rose

customer_reviews.title: Fast Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: Great router. The router is fast and doesnt slow down when I have multiple devices and multiple friends connected to it.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Ray Fan

customer_reviews.title: Solid Unit
customer_reviews.text: Read the directions and it's simple to set up. The unit has issues with it's range, but with an extender it works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great product so far
customer_reviews.text: Works and gets good speed, while im not pulling 450 like i was hoping it still works and is very stable
customer_reviews.author: Jasaun Wilkerson

customer_reviews.title: TRENDnet N900
customer_reviews.text: good q alcanse complaint not only brings off switches to meet your specifications buen alcanse la unica queja q no trae un interrupto para apagado cumple con sus especificaciones
customer_reviews.author: Elieser

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Works better than my Cisco had no problems with it. Fast speed on Wi-Fi and easy set up. Would purchase again
customer_reviews.author: HC

customer_reviews.title: defective units...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the original unit and shortly after initial setup the WIFI stopped working. I updated the firmware, but it did not make a difference. Returned it thinking it was a fluke and requested another. Got the second one and set it up only to have the exact same issues. All other devices on my network are working fine, but these items appear to be defective. Guess I will use a brand I know I can trust...
customer_reviews.author: Jon Schlatter

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Drops wifi more often than I would be happy with.
customer_reviews.author: J. Block

customer_reviews.title: Trendnet Router
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived, unpacked & installed, even with rather complex (due to outstanding flexibility) setup in very short order. Performs flawlessly anddelivers both flawless wired (home network) and wireless connectivity.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: It didn't work
customer_reviews.text: I configured the router and it wasn't difficult but then when i connect it to the DSL modem the router didn't give me any signal
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Blanco

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: every day i lost wireless signal i have to reset it all the time not work properly
customer_reviews.author: turgut

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: solid router for a great price. I hooked this in parallel with the Apple airport express and now my home has a huge network
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Snopkowski

customer_reviews.title: Bad router
customer_reviews.text: For 5 Ghz band : I found it does provide about 60 Mbps speed only having both router and laptop in same room. Connection is unstable. For 2.4 Ghz : connection is more stable then 5 Ghz, however interruptions happen from time to time. Speed is 144 Mbps (both router and laptop in same room). Resume : this router does not provide any reliable communication. Speed is also not impressive at all !
customer_reviews.author: Oleksiy

customer_reviews.title: Router (Trendnet)
customer_reviews.text: Apparently it still would not boost the signal we were hoping for, so my son just placed it in the living room for me to use it when the other signal is weak. I can't say it's a bad router, it just didn't do what my family had hoped it would.
customer_reviews.author: P Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Good but dual band mostly useless for me, perhaps not for you?
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about this but I expected my new TV (bought XMas 2011) to find the 2nd band - instead every device except one fails to find the 2nd band - I suppose its operating at an in compatible mode - I haven't had time to investigate it though....
customer_reviews.author: Scott Andrews

customer_reviews.title: does not work
customer_reviews.text: It was a defective product. Although we talked with tech support, it took to long to figure out how to set up an determine it was defective. Would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Alison

customer_reviews.title: The router is not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: The router does not have threaded antennas so you do not adptación any other antenna. I lost my money because I can not use.
customer_reviews.author: ORLANDO J SUAREZ A

customer_reviews.title: Don't Even Waste Your Time.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because of a review that I read that raved about this router. This was my first attempt at installing a router. It was a royal pain in the posterior. I tried working with this thing for at least 6 hours. I think it arrived broken from the factory. I say that because of how easy the Cisco LinkSys router installed (my next choice for a wireless router). After being totally frustrated by this thing it got sent back. Because of my really bad experience with this brand I will never try any of their other products ever. Please learn from my mistake.
customer_reviews.author: John R. DiLullo

customer_reviews.title: Tried two, both completely useless
customer_reviews.text: The first router arrived and I tried to configure it. The configuration screen wouldn't display in any browser I tried. There was something there, it just wouldn't display. Trendnet support had no idea and asked me to exchange it. The second one had the exact same problem and it wouldn't even connect to the Internet so I could look up the Trendnet phone number. After finding the number via my cel phone, the representative asked me to call back in 30 minutes. I'd had enough grief with this company and their products. The router was returned.
customer_reviews.author: Foster D. Coburn III

customer_reviews.title: Stay away from from this router
customer_reviews.text: This device is a piece of sh... All the 3 antennas look awesome, and you would conclude, that it has a wide signal range, but it is more salesman trick than a real working thing. The signal stability is another problem. It drops from minimum to maximum. 5G signal is super weak and you have strong enough signal only if have the router in front of you!!! Stay away from it. Check out other devices on the market. Update: It resets internal system date and time to Fri Dec 31 1999 every time I restart the router. And it also cannot sync time with NTP Server. For that money I could buy a box of good Californian wine!
customer_reviews.author: Sarmatæ

customer_reviews.title: Good BUT
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good but missing the following defects drop it to 0 stars: * low range, needs amps * port forwarding does not support port ranges and limited to 24, stupidity? * no USB port sharing * no power switch * power cord not long enough * doesn't stand up, keeps falling over, needs weighted base, ethernet cables are heavy I love Trendnet and I am very disappointed. UPDATE: Other than the faults, this router is SOLID. Still haven't needed a restart or to login. Updated to 2 stars. Still getting theonce available. DO NOT purchase the, this Trendnet is better.
customer_reviews.author: Morning

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING SPEEDS !!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a must buy if you are looking for the fastest signal possible. I have this connect to a trendnet TPL-401E2K and my kids and I love it for gaming. I am getting better speeds than Linksys E4200 with the same setup and same environment. MUST BUY!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Long#75

product_meta.title: TRENDnet Wireless N900 Mbps Dual-Band Gigabit Router, TEW-692GR
product_meta.description:
TRENDnet’s 450Mbps Concurrent Dual Band Wireless N Router, model TEW-692GR, is the first router to support 450Mbpsspeeds on both the 2.4GHz and 5GHz bands at the same time. This router’s raw horsepower redefines wireless networking as weknow it, to easily stream HD video through the home. Gigabit Wide Area Network and Local Area Network ports transfer wired datafast. Embedded GREENnet technology reduces port-based power consumption by up to 70%. Advanced Multiple Input MultipleOutput (MIMO) antenna technology reduces wireless dead spots. Wi-Fi Protected Setup (WPS) connects other WPS supportedwireless adapters at the touch of a button. WMM Quality of Service (QoS) technology prioritizes gaming, Internet calls, and videostreams. Assign up to four virtual networks on each wireless band and manage access control for IP addresses, website URLs,and data protocols.

AMAZON.COM




FROM THE MANUFACTURER


TEW-692GR N900 DUAL BAND WIRELESS ROUTER 
TRENDnet's N900 Dual Band Wireless Router, model TEW-692GR, is the first router to support 450Mbps speeds on both the 2.4GHz and 5GHz bands at the same time. This router's raw horsepower redefines wireless networking as we know it, to easily stream HD video through the home.

Gigabit Wide Area Network and Local Area Network ports transfer wired data fast. Embedded GREENnet technology reduces port-based power consumption by up to 70%.

Advanced Multiple Input Multiple Output (MIMO) antenna technology reduces wireless dead spots. Wi-Fi Protected Setup (WPS) connects other WPS supported wireless adapters at the touch of a button. WMM Quality of Service (QoS) technology prioritizes gaming, Internet calls, and video streams. Assign up to four virtual networks on each wireless band and manage access control for IP addresses, website URLs, and data protocols.

OVERVIEW – TEW-692GR
 * 900Mbps of total wireless throughput!

 * Concurrent Dual Band technology generates two separate 450Mbps wireless n networks at the same time

 * One touch network connection with Wi-Fi Protected Setup (WPS)

 * All Gigabit wired ports

 * Energy saving GREENnet technology


NETWORKING SPECS:
 * 1 x 10/100/1000Mbps Auto-MDIX port (Internet)

 * 4 x 10/100/1000Mbps Auto-MDIX port

 * Supported connection types: Dynamic/Static IP, PPPoE, L2TP, and PPTP connection


WIRELESS SPECS:
 * 2.412~2.462 GHz, 5.180~5.240 GHz, 5.725~5.850 GHz

 * 2.4GHz: 3 x 2dBi (internal)

 * 5GHz: 3 x 3dBi (external fixed)

 * 64/128-bit WEP, WPA/WPA2-PSK, WPA/WPA2-RADIUS

NETWORKING SOLUTION

feature_bullets: All Gigabit wired ports and supports up to N900 because of the dual-band functionality
Concurrent Dual Band technology generates two separate 450 Mbps wireless n networks at the same time
One touch network connection with Wi-Fi Protected Setup (WPS)
Easy setup via Web browser using the latest versions of Internet Explorer, FireFox, Safari, and Chrome
Internet Access Control with MAC, URL, Service Type, and IP Range filtering
